subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: what you hear is what you get
author: April Abercrombie
full_text:
------=_NextPart_000_004A_01C9D54B.522093E0
Content-Type: text/plain;
	charset="iso-8859-1"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

Noone is saying what they hear is law, just their opinion.

  ----- Origina=
l Message ----- 
  From: Frank Sumption 
  To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com 
  S=
ent: Friday, May 15, 2009 10:43 AM
  Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: what you he=
ar is what you get






   Soooo, everyone hears different, and personally=
 I find it offensive when someone presumes to tell everyone what another re=
searhcer's voices really say. I think EVP messages are for the one that rec=
orded thmm, to everyone else it's non-sense, except there's enough to show =
that there is a phenomenon. 

   I get really tired of these self proclaime=
d experts trying to dicate what's acceptable.

   Frank-S


  On Fri, May 1=
5, 2009 at 10:04 AM, Rick <rasterer@...> wrote:




    I opened your=
 folder and examined all your files.

    Here are my opinions (I have trun=
cated the file names due to laziness):

    ahh_mmm noises, no speech
    c=
all_us noises, no speech
    cal_us (enhanced) several listenings: pixelate=
d, no speech
    compare_panasonic noises, no speech
    compare_sony noise=
s, no speech
    first_epv noises, no speech
    good_whistle noises, no sp=
eech (maybe feedback)
    hey_can noises, no speech
    hey_whats noises, n=
o speech
    I_hit noises, no speech
    important_date noises, no speech
 =
   keep_moving several listenings: Hellalal see woobeh 
    laugh_evp noise=
s, no speech
    lets_wait several listenings: noises, no speech
    maybe_=
gun noises, no speech
    miss_you noises, no speech
    my_question severa=
l listenings: no da lee
    oh_ noises, no speech
    something several lis=
tenings: noises, no speech
    that_mans noises, no speech
    that's_jim n=
oises, no speech
    this_one several listenings: noises, no speech
    tom=
orrow noises, no speech

    The ones that took several listenings I though=
t I might hear words in, so I examined those several times. Sometimes I cou=
ld sort of hear something that sort of sounded like what you suggested, but=
 I could also hear it in other ways, or not at all.

    So my suggestion t=
o you, if you want to get less subjective conjuctures or simply less affirm=
ations of your own interpretations, is to post the future ones without labe=
ls. The labels you give can influence the listeners: when you have a sound =
that could be several things, and you note that it sounded like "keep it mo=
ving", the listener can find it nearly impossible to try NOT to hear what y=
ou heard, and so not be able to give a fresh perspecive to help your resear=
ch methods. 



    --- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, "James W. Hyslope" <clo=
ckdryve@...> wrote:
    >
    > Go to my Folder in the files section "Jim's=
 RR-DR60 EVP's" and see if anyone (needs to) decide "FOR ME" and let me kno=
w if I am of the serious type. In my short time I have gathered enough "pro=
of" for myself that this method works for ME. And from what I have seen fro=
m others that I have let "listen" to my files (friends) I am blessed with t=
he "ability" to HEAR very low audio artifacts....so this will help me in my=
 RESEARCH. And I am OPEN to any help to reach my goals (or help others) wit=
h their goals. Have fun people. On a HAPPIER NOTE :) I was lucky enough to =
catch the RR-DR60 taking a nap yesterday....it missed a few evp's real clos=
e together (in a 5 second clip) the Sony ICD-B7 heard a male use a differen=
t number than what I used. I said 16 (my earlier age I was saying in record=
er) and the male evp said 13....then a female laughs. All this was missed b=
y the DR60 (except my 16 was recorded in both recorders) BUT then the DR60 =
"caught" the B7 "napping" at near the end of the 5 second clip....the DR60 =
heard "let me out" in a clear (quite) males voice. So this is very promisin=
g piece of evidence for me. **those 2 recordings have been uploaded to my f=
older. I will include an Olympus W-10 (soon as arrives), Panasonic RR-US360=
 (when I think to grab it) and my RR-QR80 to go with my RR-QR100, and one m=
ore (can't remember what brand-model of this last---due to arrive) LOL. I n=
eed to build a multiple mounting devise to aid in putting these into tandem=
 service. Then I think I will use my Olympus DS-50 as my "Control" recorder=
....by using it on the HQ settings. I am looking to build a "subsonic" micr=
ophone also (something to do with those low "booms" that I have noticed lea=
d or follow many evp's). So I look forward to any ideas. Falure is NOT an o=
ption. Haha.....
    >
